lines.text:
[crashes into a tree]
I'M BLIND, ON, NO!
[opens his eyes]
I can see! It's a miracle! Another perfect landing! No worries! I'm okay! Thank you for caring. Just a few bruises.
[sees that no one is listening]
Nobody cares about me.
I do you, bat-man.
You sure?
I'm positive.
Only fools are positive.
Are you sure?
I'm positive...
[as Zak laughs]
I fell for it! I should have known!

[singing]
Yo, the name is Batty / The logic is erratic / Potato in a jacket / Toys in the attic / I rock and I ramble / My brain is scrambled / Rap like an animal, but I'm a mammal.
Now, Crysta, aren't you a little old to believe in human tales?
Human tails? Humans don't have tails. They have big, big bottoms that they wear with bad shorts. They walk around going, "Hi, Helen".
But how can you live without trees?
Easy.
But trees give life. They make the clouds, the water, the air.
We have air.
Yeah, if you don't mind getting all your minerals in one breath.
Gravity works.

[singing]
I been brain-fried, electrified, infected, and injectified / Vivisectified and fed pesticides / My face is all cut up / Cause my radar's all shut up / Nurse, I need a check-up from the neck up / I'm Batty!
[Zak is trying to convince Batty to turn back]
What're you, crazy, that's lemming talk!

[hits Batty's antenna]
Wrong channel!

[in English accent]
Hail, Caesar! Emperor of Rome!

[Batty floats offscreen]
Wrong channel!

[back onscreen; imitates John Wayne]
Well all right, Gunny! We're goin' to war!
Are you okay?

[screams to his horror]
WHAT HAPPENED TO ME! I-I-I'M THREE INCHES TALL!
Oh... I shrank you.
You what?
Well, it was the most amazing thing. 'Course, it's not what the spell was really supposed to do, but Magi Lune will fix you.
You... you shrank me?
Yeah!
Catches on quick, doesn't he?
Hello, I'm a nocturnal placental mammal of the order pterodidae, or ptero-didn't-I... In case you can't tell, I'm a bat!
Am I dead?
No.
We can fix that for ya!
But just think. Humans back in the forest!
Yep. There goes the neighborhood.
Be nice, Batty.
First thing, all these trees go. Then come your highways, then come your shopping malls, and your parking lots, and your convenience stores, and then come...
[Zak shorts out Batty's antenna]
Price check on prune juice, Bob. Price check on prune juice.
[Crysta pulls Batty from tree he just flew into]
Oh, sonic interference, what a nightmare... I thought I saw a human...
[sees Zak]
AH! HUMAN!
[falls from tree]
That's a human?
Yes! Yes! Kill it! Restrain it! Medicate it! Something!
[takes deep breaths]
Puff up! Puff up! They hate that!
What are you doing?
Carving your name. See? C-R-Y-S...
No, no, you mustn't do that! Here.
[puts Zak's hand on the carving in the tree]
Can't you feel its pain?

[in disbelief]
Its *pain*?
Yes!
Humans can't feel anything. They're numb from the brain down.

[after saving Crysta and Zak from the leveler]
"Don't go," I said. "Bad idea," I said. But would you listen? No. Don't listen to Batty. Well what do we have here? Shoes... animals don't wear shoes... A HUMAN!
A TREE!
WOAH!
[flies into tree... ]
[upon entering FernGully, Batty crashes into a tree]
Red light!
[crashes into another tree]
Red light again!

[sees Zak sliding on the windshield]
Hey, Tone, there's a little man on the windshield here.
TONY, RALPH, IT'S ME, ZAK!

[suddenly recognizes him]
Hey, Tone!
KEEP IT MOVING, BOY!
AAAAAAHHHHH!
[Crysta looks at cloud of black smoke coming from Mt. Warning and realizes Batty is not with her]
Batty? Batty... Well come on!

[looks around]
My heart! Oh! My heart!
[falls back]
... I can't go on... heaven my little wings can't make it!
Hmmm maybe you should wait here for me...
A fabulous idea... only why don't you stay here with me?

[kisses his nose]
Don't worry I'll be right back
Why do I not believe you?
Will you both just calm down?
He tried to kill you!
I did not! You did!

[Hexxus knocks over a headlamp that's about to fall on Batty]
Oh, this is gonna hurt...
I have but one claw, but beware!
Fasten your seatbelts, it's going to be a bumpy night!

[follows Crysta]
Yeah, this territory looks kinda familiar. Fabulous day in the canopy, isn't it. Well, where do you think you're going?
Mount Warning.
[Batty goes stunned an knocks into a tree]
I know where I am. I know where I am. HEY! You scared me there. For a minute, I thought you said you were going to Mount Warning.
Well, I did.
BUT THERE'RE HUMANS ON MOUNT WARNING!
Exactly!

Fractured fig, fairy bug, come on! Mount Warning is the last place a little fairy like you wants to go. Look at these! D'you think nature did this? D'you think I put this on to get better reception? NO! Humans did this. We should stay here. It's nice here.

[after Zak lights a match, gasps]
What is it?
It's fire.

[curiously]
That's fire?
[Crysta touches it until]
OW!
Careful!
What about you, Crysta? What is it that fairies do?
Do?
Yeah, do you have jobs or something?
What's a job?
Guess that answers that question. Look, what do you do all day?
Help things grow.
Really? That sounds cool.
No, usually it's warm.
No, cool means it's hot.
What?
You know - bodacious, bad, tubular...
Awesome use of the language, dude.
As in, you are one bodacious babe.
And that's good... I mean, cool?
That's right! We're communicating.
Tubular!
Buzz off? I'm not buzzing anywhere. Now unshrink me, and I mean now.
Well, I guess I could take a bash at it.
"Take a bash"?
Actually, I'm just sort of learning.
Great, I've been shrunk by an amateur. I don't believe this. Okay, okay, come on! Bash away!
What are you supposed to be, some kind of fairy?
Of course I am. What about you? Are you really a human?
Last time I checked.
Are you sure the leveler can handle this baby?
Sure, the leveler eats anything.
Kinda like you.
How many times a day I have to threaten your life?

[about to eat Zak]
Welcome to the food chain.
Stop! He's a human!
Uhh... what's a human?
Delicious and nutritious! Tastes just like chicken!

[Crysta glares at Batty, then flies over to the Goanna]
He's my friend.
Any friend of a fairy...
[spits out Zak]
... is a friend of mine.
Thanks.
You owe me a free dinner after this one.
[first lines]

[opening narration]
Our world was much larger then. The forest went on forever. We tree spirits nurtured the harmony of all living things, but our closest friends were humans. Then, as sometimes happens, the balance of nature shifted. Hexxus, the very spirit of destruction rose up from the bowels of the earth, and rained down his poison. The forest was nearly destroyed, many lives were lost and the humans fled in fear, never to return. Most believe they did not survive. It was only by calling up the magical powers of nature, that I was able to trap Hexxus inside an enchanted tree, and save FernGully.

[preventing Batty from getting dizzier after his first appearance]
Bless your heart with magic light; I give the gift of fairy sight!
Magi, don't leave me!
I love you. I'll always be with you.
[Magic fades away into blue specks]
We all have the power - and it grows when it is shared. Remember what you learned, Crysta.
[the specks scatter to all the fairies, including Zak as the tree opens back up]

[sadly]
Oh, Magi...

Ahhh... delicious... a first-class smoke. Mother's milk. And what is this delightful thing? And how did I get out of that tree? Oh, of course. Humans. What wonderful creatures. So clever. So helpful. I must take this wonderful human thing to... Fern... Gully...
[evil chuckle]
What's a machine?
It's a... thing. Cutting down trees.
That's terrible!
Only if you live in a tree.
I *do* live in a tree!
Oh.

[feeling a freshly cut stump with her hand which glows from the pain]
Magi, can you heal it?

[solemnly]
A force outside of nature did this. I can't heal it, and I can't stop it.
a monster the humans fight. Humans can stop it. They have these magic red marks that...
[Magi cuts her by shaking her head no as they turn seeing a huge dark red 'X' mark on the stump]

[appalled]
But Zak said...
[Crysta flies further out passing all the red X's, to her shock the whole forest is gone, she then sees humans loading the logs onto a tractor-trailer]

[sadly]
Humans did it. Humans did it all.

[seeing a tree about to crush Zak after he catches her]
Bless your eyes with magic light; I give the gift of fairy size - oh, sight!
Zak!
What happened here?
[they see the entire forest almost empty with tree stumps, Zak smiles and plants a seed remembering what Crysta told him]
I will remember.
[Zak leaves with Tony and Ralph]

[solemnly]
Guys, things have gotta change.
Hey, what's going on, Zak?
Huh? What are you talking about?
the forest! You know what's happening, don't you?
But...
Good idea, ask the human. He may know.
Crysta?

[in tears, angry]
You lied to me!
Uh... I... Crysta!
[Crysta flies off in anger]
all the magic of creation exists within a single tiny seed.

[after a falcon nearly attacks them, to Crysta]
Are you crazy going above the canopy?
Yeah! We were almost falcon fodders!

[remorsefully]
I wish - I wish the human tales were true. They're not here to protect the forest; they're cutting down trees.
[the fairies gasp in shock]
They're destroying the forest! And I was helping them do it. Batty was right.

[in surprise]
I was?
They're coming this way. You can't stop them. You'll have to leave.

[about to change Zak back to his normal size]
What was done, now undo. Return you to the form that's true. Good-bye, Zak.

[to the construction-drivers posing as their boss]
Make sure you use plenty of oil!

[to the leveler]
I do believe we are destined to be soul-mates!

[about Zak]
He's a bodacious babe!
Look for the hero inside yourself, Crysta. Look to the good and loving heart in you and all others.
Halt! Who goes there!
Hi, Crysta!
Okay, what's the password?
Oh, come on, you guys!
Hey, is that the password? It sounds good.

[flies off]
Bye!
Bye! That's it, that's the password.
I don't know if that's the password or not. I'm so confused!
Oh oh, oh oh, big ears! Elephant! No, no, no, anteater! Oh, orangutan! Ok, ok, let me guess again- a duck! A duck! Ooohhh, it's Darwin's grab bag!

[singing]
I see the world and all the creatures in it, / I suck 'em dry and spit 'em out like spinach. / 'Cause greedy human beings will always lend a hand, / with the destruction of this worthless jungle land. / And what a wonderful machine they have provided, / To slice a path of doom with my sweet breath to guide it.

There are worlds within worlds, Crysta. Everything in our world is connected by the delicate strands of the web of life, which is a balance between the forces of destruction and the magical forces of creation.
So, what the Mage have to say?
She said I should start getting serious.
'Bout time.
Oh, and stop hanging around with bug-brained layabouts like you.
Why don't you come with me and the boys? We'll give you a taste of real FernGully wildlife? Unless of course you're not up to it.
I'm up for anything you can dish out, bud.
